pull.title: refactor: Serialization parameter cleanups
pull.body:
Cleanups after #25284:

 * ser_action namespacing - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25284#discussion_r1316189977 
 * make reference implicit - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25284#discussion_r1316277030
 * function notation - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25284#issuecomment-1710714821

events.message: serialize: move ser_action functions out of global namespace
serialize: specify type for ParamsWrapper not ref

scripted-diff: use SER_PARAMS_OPFUNC

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i 's/WithParams(\(CAddress::V[12]_[A-Z]*\) *, */\1(/g' $(git grep -l 'WithParams' src/)
sed -i 's/WithParams(\(CNetAddr::V[12]\) *, */\1(/g' $(git grep -l 'WithParams' src/)
sed -i 's@\(CNetAddr::V1.CService{}.*\)    //@\1                //@' src/test/util/net.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#28451](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28451) (Remove unused SER_DISK, SER_NETWORK, SER_GETHASH by MarcoFalke)
* [#26859](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26859) (fuzz: extend ConsumeNetAddr() to return I2P and CJDNS addresses by vasild)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: Use serialization parameters for CTransaction
issue.body:
Choose whether witness is included in transaction serialization via serialization parameter rather than the stream version. See #25284 and #19477 for previous context.

Why is this draft?
 * This touches consensus code. Might make sense to merge it shortly after the 26.0 release, so it can bake for as long a time as possible before being included in released code?
 * It removes support for `-rpcserialversion`.
   * This is mainly because that uses `RPCSerializationFlags()` and `rpcSerializationFlags()` interfaces which don't really match the new model.
   * Is that option even worth keeping at this point, now that downstream projects have implemented segwit?
   * If it's not worth keeping, should we deprecate the option in 26.0 before removing it in 27.0?
   * Should we replace it with a `strip_witness` options for some rpcs, eg `getblock`?

issue.title: Remove unused SER_DISK, SER_NETWORK, SER_GETHASH
issue.body:
Seems odd to have code that is completely dead.

Fix this by removing all of it.

issue.title: fuzz: extend ConsumeNetAddr() to return I2P and CJDNS addresses
issue.body: In the process of doing so, refactor `ConsumeNetAddr()` to generate the addresses from IPv4, IPv6, Tor, I2P and CJDNS networks in the same way - by preparing some random stream and deserializing from it. Similar code was already found in `RandAddr()`.

Yeah, up to you. I personally don't see a risk in `s << ser_params(addr);` and it is shorter and consistent with the `s << V1(addr);` stuff. So I'll use it in new code, and potentially do the scripted-diff at some point, but no strong opinion.
